channel.title: Am I Running Low on Memory?
channel.description:
This may be a stupid question, but anyone who knows me has come to terms with my knowlage of computers is that they run by "magic." :jizz:
The little start button do hickey has a computer tab, and when I clicked on it, I noticed something that said Hard Disk Drive (yes, I know that is what stores your computers info) and it said 81 gb left out of 451. Should I start deleting some of my games, or do I still have some memory left.
If I am running low, how do I get more memory.

item.title: Am I Running Low on Memory?
item.dc:creator: Rabbiddog
item.description:
Depending on how much RAM you have and which operating system you use, you may not even need to use Virtual Memory. I haven’t used VM since Win7 came out and used 8GB pf RAM. So for several years at least.

Read full topic

item.source: Am I Running Low on Memory?

item.title: Am I Running Low on Memory?
item.dc:creator: MRPolo
item.description:
Don’t listen to them all. At least most. For a start, you’re not running low on RAM (Random Available Memory) which is what is considered as “memory” for a computer.
The issue discussed here is not memory but Hard Drive space. You have 81 gigabytes and that is seriously more than enough for now. However, if you want to, look for games that you no longer play. Whenever I do such sweep I get around 20 gigabytes more, and that’s me being conservative.
81 gig is enough to, as an example, install 4 Team Fortress 2s. As I said, it’ll keep you going for weeks if you don’t install every day. You don’t even need an upgrade of any sort since your overall Hard Drive space is 481. As I said, you may want to do a quick sweep through your PC if you’re not happy with 81 gig. However, that is not necessary at all.

Read full topic
item.source: Am I Running Low on Memory?
